sponsor: Cubist Pharmaceuticals LLC, a subsidiary of Merck & Co., Inc. (Rahway, New Jersey USA)
briefTitle: A Study of CB-183,315 in Participants With Clostridium Difficile Associated Diarrhea (MK-4261-006)
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blinded, Active-Controlled Study of CB-183,315 in Patients With Clostridium Difficile Associated Diarrhea
summary: A total of 608 participants with Clostridium Difficile Associated Diarrhea (CDAD) will participate in this study; participants will receive either oral vancomycin or CB-183,315 in a blinded fashion. Treatment will last for 10 days and participants will be followed up for at least 40 days and a maximum of 100 days. The purpose of this study is to evaluate how well CB-183,315 treats CDAD as compared to vancomycin.

primaryOutcome.measure: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Meeting Clinical Response Criteria for Cure at End of Treatment (EOT)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Up to 3 days after EOT (up to Day 13)
